name: Chapter 1: Observing the Armies on the Battlefield of Kurukṣetra
description: Arjuna's emotional struggle and moral dilemma on the Kurukshetra battlefield, setting the stage for the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita.
author: Author 1

name: Chapter 2: Contents of the Gītā Summarized
description: Introduction to philosophical concepts, duty, and paths of spiritual discipline, addressing doubts and fears.
author: Author 2

name: Chapter 3: Karma Yoga
description: The significance of selfless actions and duty, aligning actions with righteousness and spiritual principles.
author: Author 3

name: Chapter 4: Transcendental Knowledge
description: Combines knowledge and action, emphasizing duty and knowledge's role in liberation and renunciation.
author: Author 4

name: Chapter 5: Karma-yoga – Action in Kṛṣṇa Consciousness
description: Focuses on renunciation and detachment, guiding seekers toward a contemplative life and spiritual realization.
author: Author 5

name: Chapter 6: Dhyāna-yoga
description: Teaches disciplined meditation and self-control, aiding seekers in achieving mental and spiritual steadiness.
author: Author 6

name: Chapter 7: Knowledge of the Absolute
description: Explores divine wisdom, knowledge, and understanding the divine aspects and spiritual realities of the universe.
author: Author 7

name: Chapter 8: Attaining the Supreme
description: Reveals the imperishable, eternal, and transcendent reality, guiding seekers on the path to spiritual liberation.
author: Author 8

name: Chapter 9: The Most Confidential Knowledge
description: Unveils the royal knowledge and royal secret, elucidating the essence of spirituality and divine wisdom.
author: Author 9

name: Chapter 10: The Opulence of the Absolute
description: Expounds divine manifestations, illustrating the infinite opulences and expressions of the Supreme Divine.
author: Author 10

name: Chapter 11: The Universal Form
description: Divine universal form revelation, showcasing the cosmic magnificence and the omnipresence of the Divine.
author: Author 11

name: Chapter 12: Devotional Service
description: Promotes the path of devotion and love towards the Divine, guiding seekers to experience divine grace.
author: Author 12

name: Chapter 13: Nature, the Enjoyer and Consciousness
description: Distinguishes the physical body and the soul, elucidating knowledge and the nature of the material and spiritual worlds.
author: Author 13

name: Chapter 14: The Three Modes of Material Nature
description: Explains the three gunas (modes) and their influence on individuals, offering insights into transcendence and liberation.
author: Author 14

name: Chapter 15: The Yoga of the Supreme Person
description: Describes the eternal tree of life, elucidating the concept of the eternal, imperishable Supreme Being and the soul.
author: Author 15

name: Chapter 16: The Divine and Demoniac Natures
description: Contrasts divine and demonic qualities, enlightening seekers about righteous and unrighteous behavior and their consequences.
author: Author 16

name: Chapter 17: The Divisions of Faith
description: Explores the threefold faith, defining faith's qualities and its influence on individuals and their actions.
author: Author 17

name: Chapter 18: Conclusion – The Perfection of Renunciation
description: Covers renunciation and liberation, guiding individuals to attain liberation through the path of renunciation and selfless action.
author: Author 18
